main event: On February 5 and 6, 1960, a brilliant red light was observed hovering over Hollywood, California, for several minutes, with multiple witnesses reporting unusual behaviors and an explosion linked to the phenomenon.
interesting points: The sightings were reported by hundreds of witnesses, including local residents and police officers., The red light was described as pulsating and varying in size, with estimates ranging from the size of a baseball to one-third the size of the full moon., Witnesses reported the red light remaining stationary for periods of 8 to 10 minutes before moving again., An explosion was heard and a flash of light was observed during the sightings, leading to a mushroom cloud formation., The U.S. Weather Bureau and other authorities found no weather balloons released in the area during the timeframe.
witness description: Residents, including service station employees, local pilots, and police officers.
